original: @423a rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @423a rgya gar skad du /

original: a'arya sarba aa bha ya pra d'a na n'a ma dha ra ni /
analyzed: a'arya sarba aa bha ya pra d'a na n'a ma dha ra ni /

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /

original: 'phags pa thams cad la mi 'jigs pa spyin pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs /
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad la mi 'jigs pa spyin pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs /

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa @423b dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa @423b dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das yul ma ga dha nas yul rgyu zhing aa mra'i tshal du gshegs te byon nas aa mra'i tshal lus 'phags ri'i dbang po'i brag phug na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yul ma ga dha nas yul rgyu zhing aa mra'i tshal du gshegs te byon nas aa mra'i tshal lus 'phags ri'i dbang po'i brag phug na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was wandering in the country of Magadha and arrived at the Mango Grove. He stayed in the cave of the Lord of the Mountain of Auspiciousness in the Mango Grove.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, went to where the Blessed One was. Having arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Sitting to one side, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: lha ma yin rnams ni /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams ni /

original: rab tu gnod par bgyid pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu gnod par bgyid pa ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: lha ma yin rnams ni /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams ni /

original: bdag la yun ring por phyir rgol ba'i dgra lags na /
analyzed: bdag la yun ring por phyir rgol ba'i dgra lags na /

original: de las bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la chos bstan du gsol /
analyzed: de las bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la chos bstan du gsol /
translated: Blessed One, please teach me the Dharma.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When he had thus requested, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: lha'i dbang po /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po /

original: khyod kyis thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i rig sngags don thams cad byed pa /
analyzed: khyod kyis thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i rig sngags don thams cad byed pa /
translated: you should give the knowledge-mantra that grants fearlessness to all, which accomplishes all aims,

original: 'jigs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa /

original: nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa; dug thams cad 'jil ba /
analyzed: nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa; dug thams cad 'jil ba /
translated: which completely pacifies all illnesses, which neutralizes all poisons,

original: mtshon thams cad rengs par byed pa /
analyzed: mtshon thams cad rengs par byed pa /

original: rkang med dang / rkang gnyis dang / rkang bzhi pa thams cad rengs par byed pa /🔽dgra thams cad @424a *//
analyzed: rkang med dang / rkang gnyis dang / rkang bzhi pa thams cad rengs par byed pa / dgra thams cad @424a *//
translated: which paralyzes all those without legs, those with two legs, and those with four legs,

original: phung par byed pa /
analyzed: phung par byed pa /
translated: which destroys all enemies,🔽which brings about the destruction of all adversaries,

analyzed: lha dang / nam mkha' lding dang / sbyin byed ma'i bu dang / sha za dang / brjed byed dang / smyo byed dang / bram ze'i srin po dang / 'byung po dang / ro langs dang / bya'i gdon dang / srul po dang / nam gru dang / gnon po'i gdan dang / gnon po dang / brjed byed kyi gdon dang / lha'i gdon dang / klu'i gdon dang / gnod sbyin gyi gdon dang / dri za'i gdon dang / mi 'am ci'i gdon dang / log 'dren gyi gdon dang / ma mo'i gdon phung bar byed pa /
translated: gods, garuḍas, piśācas, bhūtas, vetālas, kaṭapūtanas, unmādas, brāhma-rākṣasas, bhūtas, vetālas, bird grahas, pūtanas, and rākṣasas.

analyzed: nad kyis ma yin te /

analyzed: chus 'chi ba'i dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not die from drowning.

original: rig sngags dang / gsang sngags sbyor ba sgrub pa thams cad sbyor ba rnams kyis ma grub pa rnams grub par byed do //
analyzed: rig sngags dang / gsang sngags sbyor ba sgrub pa thams cad sbyor ba rnams kyis ma grub pa rnams grub par byed do //
translated: All the applications of knowledge-mantras and secret-mantras that have not been accomplished will be accomplished.

original: sbyar te grub pa rnams gzhan gyis mi tshugs par byed do //
analyzed: sbyar te grub pa rnams gzhan gyis mi tshugs par byed do //
translated: Those that have been accomplished will not be overcome by others.

original: pha rol gyis bcings pa las grol bar byed do //
analyzed: pha rol gyis bcings pa las grol bar byed do //
translated: One will be freed from the bonds of others.

original: gzhan gyis rig sngags gcod par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rig sngags gcod par byed do //
translated: One will cut the knowledge-mantras of others.

original: bdag gi rig sngags 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: bdag gi rig sngags 'phel bar byed do //

original: gdon thams cad phung bar byed do //
analyzed: gdon thams cad phung bar byed do //

original: gdon gang gis mi gtong na yang /
analyzed: gdon gang gis mi gtong na yang /
translated: If any graha does not let go,

original: de'i mgo aardza ka'i dog pa bzhin du tshal pa bdun du 'gas so //
analyzed: de'i mgo aardza ka'i dog pa bzhin du tshal pa bdun du 'gas so //
translated: his head will split into seven pieces like the seedpod of the arjaka plant.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, disappeared right there.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: When the Blessed One had said this, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, rejoiced in what the Blessed One had said.

original: 'phags pa thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
translated: The noble Dhāraṇī called “Bestowing Fearlessness on All” is complete.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lo tstsha ba bandhe ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / zhu chen gyi lo tstsha ba bandhe ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te /
translated: The Indian preceptors Jinamitra and Dānaśīla, and the editor-translator Bandé Yeshé Dé, translated and revised this text.

original: skad gsar bcad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: skad gsar bcad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la phab pa /
translated: It was finalized and established as the definitive version.
